image.altText: A girl looks towards the camera while sitting on her father's lap.

props.synopsis: It took 10-year-old Ashley Clifford's parents a decade of bouncing from specialist to specialist for their daughter to be diagnosed with Beck-Fahrner syndrome, and they're confident more families are in the same limbo they once were.

title.children: 10-year-old Ashley is one of only 30 people in the world known to have Beck-Fahrner syndrome

image.altText: The exterior of a building with a sign that reads "Lyneham High School".

props.synopsis: According to an email sent to parents and carers the school went into a precautionary lockdown after some students came onto school grounds in a "heightened" state and using threatening behaviour.

title.children: Canberra school hires security guard, locks some entrances after students use 'threatening' behaviour

image.altText: A man in a black shirt and a women in a white shirt holding two gold hand statues.

props.synopsis: Police found the hand statues, along with other allegedly stolen items including a pump action rifle, while searching a 39-year-old man's home in north Canberra.Â

title.children: Tony was 'devastated' when two gold hands were stolen from his son's grave. Now, they have been returned

image.altText: a man's silhouette

props.synopsis: He decided tough, decisive and quick action was needed.

title.children: After his son was bullied, this father took out a personal protection order against the teenage perpetrator

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court hears Michael Peacock, 42, pulled a knife to rob the woman as she walked to work because begging had failed to make him enough money to buy cigarettes and cannabis.

title.children: Canberra man pulled knife on woman to rob her because he was going 'crazy' for lack of tobacco, court hears

image.altText: Two women walking down stairs, avoiding eye contact with the camera.

props.synopsis: The 32-year-old was working at a plumbing business when it's alleged she took the money over a two-and-a-half year period.

title.children: Woman accused of stealing $700,000 from her workplace through illegitimate invoices and extra salary pleads not guilty

image.altText: Jockey Robbie Dolan rides Knights Choice to victory ahead of Warp Speed

props.synopsis: Knight's Choice has caused a boilover at Flemington, winning the 164th Melbourne Cup. Follow live.

title.children: Knight's Choice causes massive upset to win Melbourne Cup by a nose

image.altText: A group of four women in colourful dresses and headwear pose for a photo with a boy in a shirt and waistcoat.

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of racegoers have flocked to Flemington under sunny skies, to celebrate the race that stops a nation.

title.children: Crowds gather at the rails of Flemington Racecourse, where horse racing meets high fashion

image.altText: People walking past the outside of the Reserve Bank of Australia in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia has kept interest rates on hold at 4.35 per cent for its eighth-straight meeting despite inflation falling to its lowest level in almost four years.

title.children: RBA not ruling out future interest rate rises after warning inflation 'remains too high'

image.altText: A man and a woman hold hands and smile at each other while outdoors walking

props.synopsis: While Canberra is one of the least-religious states and territories in the country, for those who adhere to a faith, it's the most important thing in their lives. So what does that look like?

title.children: Meet the faithful â what does religion look like in Canberra?

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia has held the official cash rate at 4.35pc, while the ASX lost ground. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News markets blog.Â

title.children: RBA leaves cash rate at 4.35pc, ASX loses ground â as it happened

image.altText: a woman flanked by others entering court

props.synopsis: In December 2021, six children died and three were injured after the jumping castle they were playing on became airborne, with the tragedy making international headlines.Â

title.children: 'Mini tornado' lifted jumping castle 20m into air, leading to deaths of six Tasmanian students, court hears

image.altText: Jason Kelce wears a microphone before broadcasting an NFL game for ESPN.

props.synopsis: Days after footage of Jason Kelce smashing a fan's phone went viral, the former NFL star apologises for responding to the man's alleged homophobic slur "with hate".

title.children: 'I chose to greet hate with hate': Jason Kelce apologises for smashing fan's phone after alleged homophobic slur

image.altText: Russian naval officers are welcomed in Indonesia

props.synopsis: Indonesia begins its first-ever joint naval drills with Russia while simultaneously conducting military exercises with Australian forces.

title.children: 'Enemies to no-one': Indonesia starts military drills with both Russia and Australia

image.altText: How the Electoral College Really Works: A man with brown hair and glasses looks up with crossed arms at a map of the US.

props.synopsis: Casey Briggs explains the United States' complicated election system where people do not actually vote for Donald Trump or Kamala Harris.

title.children: How the US electoral college works

image.altText: An Israeli Air Force plane in a hanger

props.synopsis: There were no immediate reports of casualties in the air strike, which Syria said hit a civilian area in the Sayeda Zeinab region south of the capital.

title.children: Israel says it struck Hezbollah intelligence assets in air strike near Damascus

image.altText: A person watches the news bulletin.

props.synopsis: North Korea fires at least seven short-range ballistic missiles off its east coast, Japan's defence minister says, shortly after Pyongyang condemns military drills by its rivals.

title.children: North Korea fires multiple short-range missiles in protest at rivals' military drills

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFLW teammate puts her arm around Dakota Davidson, who appears to be crying.

props.synopsis: The AFL Integrity Unit is investigating an incident after Dakota Davidson was the latest AFLW player to be the target of abuse this season.

title.children: 'Wasn't just that game. It's every game': AFLW community calls for targeted abuse to stop

image.altText: Lady holding a wallet with 20 dollar bills.

props.synopsis: Australians have billions of dollars of unclaimed money from bank accounts, investments, insurance and superannuation.Â

title.children: Four ways to check if you're entitled to the billions of unclaimed money in Australia

image.altText: Emperor penguin in care

props.synopsis: A young emperor penguin has captured the attention of locals and researchers by arriving at an unexpected location in Western Australia, a long way from its Antarctic home.

title.children: Emperor penguin waddles up to surfer at WA beach in most northern recorded sighting of species

image.altText: A young white woman kneeling on grass and petting a border collie dog, which is wearing a vest that says 'assistance animal'

props.synopsis: Qantas agrees to change and clarify its application processes for assistance dogs after being sued for disability discrimination.

title.children: 'Inconceivable': Qantas settles assistance dog discrimination case

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a suit jacket

props.synopsis: A man charged over an alleged plot to murder Sydney identity John Ibrahim has been denied bail despite his lawyer proposing "extremely restrictive" conditions, including house arrest, ankle bracelet monitoring and a surety of up to $1.4 million.

title.children: Man accused of planning failed murder plot of Sydney identity John Ibrahim denied bail

image.altText: man in his seventies holding a bunch of flowers

props.synopsis: A man accused of throwing another man off a Brisbane balcony in a random attack allegedly sparked over cigarettes has been ordered to stand trial for murder.

title.children: Man accused of throwing 74yo off balcony in random attack ordered to stand trial for murder

image.altText: Quincy Jones smiling and pointing, headshot, wearing a suit, the letters tiff behind him

props.synopsis: Music titan Quincy Jones is being remembered by entertainment heavyweights as everyone from Will Smith to Elton John pays tribute to Jones, who has died. He was 91.

title.children: Quincy Jones remembered by entertainment industry heavyweights as stars reflect on his legacy

image.altText: The Amityville home where Ronald DeFeo killed his family.

props.synopsis: Many of our architectural ideas seep into popular culture not through design publications, but through movies and TV shows, becoming part of our visual and design catalogue.

title.children: The hidden architectural gems in pop culture

image.altText: A young boy in a black tee short holds up two fish.

props.synopsis: The family of 11-year-old Laith Alaid have thanked volunteers and community members who "selflessly dedicated their time and resources" to search for the boy who was swept out to sea.

title.children: Multi-agency search for missing 11yo boy suspended off NSW Central Coast

image.altText: A university graduate wearing a gown and cap is seen outside Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: The federal government hopes to announce a promise to change university course fees before the year's end, with its one-off cuts to existing graduate debts considered an "interim" measure.Â

title.children: One-off HECS debt cut a placeholder as government looks to change university course fees

image.altText: Australia captain Pat Cummins signs autographs for fans after an ODI against Pakistan.

props.synopsis: After Australia's captain dug his team out of trouble with the bat in the first ODI against Pakistan, Mitchell Starc says Pat Cummins should be bumped up the batting order.Â

title.children: With his eyes 'fixed', Pat Cummins rescues Australia and could be set for a promotion

image.altText: Racegoers walk through the gates at Flemington on Melbourne Cup day

props.synopsis: Anti-racing protesters and animal rights advocates are optimistic the tide has permanently turned against horse racing and fewer young people are watching the Melbourne Cup. But with the #NupToTheCup movement appearing to lose steam, celebrities and influencers are back at Flemington in force.

title.children: Melbourne Cup day raises complicated feelings about horse racing for many Australians

image.altText: bald man with beard smiles while taking selfie with group of young people

props.synopsis: The Prince of Wales will have four days of engagements in Cape Town, with the trip heavily focusing on climate change and conservation.

title.children: Prince William meets environmentalists and plays rugby in South Africa

image.altText: Roads ripped under flood waters.

props.synopsis: The army sent a total of about 7,500 soldiers over the weekend to help distribute food and water, clean up streets and guard against looters.Â

title.children: Spain deploys more troops to flood zone as authorities warn of landslides and more flooding

image.altText: A group of Labor MPs stand by a microphone.

props.synopsis: Steven Miles will today nominate to lead Queensland Labor in opposition at the party's first caucus meeting since losing the state election.

title.children: Former premier elected unopposed as party leader after election loss

image.altText: A young boy and girl sit on a bench in the park hugging each other, facing away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Asking someone to be your child's legal guardian is a big deal, so we sought advice on the best way to go about it â and what to consider before you do.

title.children: How to choose a legal guardian for your child when making a will

image.altText: A smiling, older woman with grey hair.

props.synopsis: The model turns empty buildings into homes for vulnerable women and a shelter organisation wants it expanded to give more people a safe place to sleep at night amid the housing crisis.

title.children: Housing model that's 'gold' for women fleeing domestic violence

image.altText: Casey Donovan poses in Sydney's State Theatre by a record player with mixing desk

props.synopsis: Casey Donovan has had her share of high and low points since winning Australian Idol in 2004, but the performer, singer and actor tells Take 5's Zan Rowe that she never wants to lose her vulnerability.

title.children: 'Music comes into your life when you need it': Casey Donovan on 20 years in the spotlight
